DataElement.preferredName: Nurse Coach Minimum Two Year Oncology Palliative Therapy Experience Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indication of whether the Nurse Coach has a minimum of two years of experience in either an oncology or palliative care setting.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Nurse Coach Minimum Two Year Oncology Palliative Therapy Experience Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A registered nurse with specialized training in peer and/or health and wellness coaching that provides guidance and resources to patients, colleagues, or institutions towards making positive changes and achieving goals._The smallest possible quantity._A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one._A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period._The study of tumors encompassing the physical, chemical, and biologic properties._The patient- and family-centered active holistic care of patients with advanced, progressive disease. Essential components of palliative care are: pain and symptom control, communication regarding treatment and alternatives, prognosis, and available services, rehabilitation services, care that addresses treatment and palliative concerns, intellectual, emotional, social, and spiritual needs, terminal care, support in bereavement. The goal of palliative care is an achievement of the best quality of life for patients and their families._The accumulation of knowledge or skill that results from direct participation in events or activities._In clinical trials, requirements that must be met for a person to be included in a trial. These requirements help make sure that participants in a trial are like each other in terms of specific factors such as age, type and stage of cancer, general health, and previous treatment. When all participants meet the same eligibility criteria, it is more likely that results of the study are caused by the intervention being tested and not by other factors or by chance.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A registered nurse with specialized training in peer and/or health and wellness coaching that provides guidance and resources to patients, colleagues, or institutions towards making positive changes and achieving goals.

Concepts.definition: A registered nurse with specialized training in peer and/or health and wellness coaching that provides guidance and resources to patients, colleagues, or institutions towards making positive changes and achieving goals.

Property.preferredName: Minimum Two Year Oncology Palliative Therapy Experience Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The smallest possible quantity.:A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.:A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.:The study of tumors encompassing the physical, chemical, and biologic properties.:The patient- and family-centered active holistic care of patients with advanced, progressive disease. Essential components of palliative care are: pain and symptom control, communication regarding treatment and alternatives, prognosis, and available services, rehabilitation services, care that addresses treatment and palliative concerns, intellectual, emotional, social, and spiritual needs, terminal care, support in bereavement. The goal of palliative care is an achievement of the best quality of life for patients and their families.:The accumulation of knowledge or skill that results from direct participation in events or activities.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
The study of tumors encompassing the physical, chemical, and biologic properties.

The patient- and family-centered active holistic care of patients with advanced, progressive disease. Essential components of palliative care are: pain and symptom control, communication regarding treatment and alternatives, prognosis, and available services, rehabilitation services, care that addresses treatment and palliative concerns, intellectual, emotional, social, and spiritual needs, terminal care, support in bereavement. The goal of palliative care is an achievement of the best quality of life for patients and their families.
The accumulation of knowledge or skill that results from direct participation in events or activities.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for URMC curation request. 11.5.2020 mc
